data.title: Types of Digital Media
data.meta_description: There are three types of digital media that can be used together to create a comprehensive marketing strategy that reaches a wider audience and achieves business goals. Owned Media, Earned Media, and Paid Media.
data.text:
LinkedIn and 3rd parties use essential and non-essential cookies to provide, secure, analyze and improve our Services, and to show you relevant ads (including professional and job ads) on and off LinkedIn. Learn more in our Cookie Policy.

Select Accept to consent or Reject to decline non-essential cookies for this use. You can update your choices at any time in your settings.

Earned media: Earned media refers to the positive mentions of a business or individual that are generated by others, such as in news articles, social media posts, and reviews. Earned media is often considered to be the most valuable type of digital media, as it is seen as a sign of trust and credibility.

The specific types of digital media that a business or individual uses will depend on their target audience, budget, and goals. For example, a business that is targeting a younger audience may focus more on social media marketing, while a business that is targeting a more affluent audience may focus more on paid advertising.

It is important to note that the three types of digital media are not mutually exclusive. In fact, it is often most effective to use a combination of all three types to create a comprehensive marketing strategy. For example, a business may use owned media to build brand awareness, earned media to generate positive mentions, and paid media to reach a wider audience.
